arguments.name: lookup_value
arguments.description: The value that you want to match in lookup_array . For example, when you look up someone's number in a telephone book, you are using the person's name as the lookup value, but the telephone number is the value you want. The lookup_value argument can be a value (number, text, or logical value) or a cell reference to a number, text, or logical value.

arguments.name: lookup_array
arguments.description: The range of cells being searched.

arguments.name: match_type
arguments.description: The number -1, 0, or 1. The match_type argument specifies how Excel matches lookup_value with values in lookup_array . The default value for this argument is 1. The following table describes how the function finds values based on the setting of the match_type argument.
